alert.note: Alert for Liberty; Long (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 09 at 2:23PM EST until January 09 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Tornado Warning for portions of... Liberty County in southeastern Georgia... Long County in southeastern Georgia... * Until 300 PM EST. * At 223 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Doctortown, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include: Hinesville, Ludowici, Fort Stewart, McIntosh, Walthourville, Midway, Riceboro, Flemington, Allenhurst, Gumbranch, and Gum Branch. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
